result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Drozda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full time employment at the discretion of his agent.  Defendant shall undergo any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in court with attorney Shari L Post.  Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No factual inaccuracies in the PSI.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Agreement put into the record.  Argument by Attorney Post. Court orders 2 years prison - one year initial confinement followed by one year extended supervision with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; obtain/maintain full time employment at agent's discretion.  The bond shall be applied towards any restitution in all of his cases and the balance shall be put towards court costs.  Concurrent to 16CF112. - rt

Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court Orders PSI.  Sentencing scheduled for April 18, 2017.  - rt

Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in court with attorney Shari L Post.  Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Post indicated that the defendant is going to waive his preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant regarding his preliminary hearing.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Defendant waives the reading of Information.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Pretrial conference scheduled for January 27, 2017 at 10:30 am. - rt

Taylor County Arrest Report

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions of: booking and no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  DE makes statement. Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for April 12, 2016 at 1:00 p.m. ba
